channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024061890
item.description:
Report X-2024061890

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS A UN SPECIFICATION DOUBLE WALL FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING 4 PLASTIC CONTAINERS. EACH PLASTIC CONTAINER WAS SEALED IN ITS OWN PLASTIC BAG. CONTAINER CAPS LOOSENED AND LEAKED DURING TRANSPORT. PACKAGE WAS WET AND SOILED BUT THERE WAS NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE THE PACKAGE

item.title: Report E-2024060665
item.description:
Report E-2024060665

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint were dropped during loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted site. Before EW personnel arrived, personnel from the customer location attempted to clean the paint with a power washer, spreading the paint out through the parking lot. Crews deployed granular absorbent to the concrete and worked them in with hand tools. Once all free product was collected, crews utilized a power washer to further remediate the surface area and added the rinsate to the existing drums of waste. All paint-impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.
